title: Wayne Julies
text:
Wayne Julies (born 23 October 1978 in <a href="Paarl">Paarl</a>) is a <a href="South%20Africa">South African</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He has played for the national team, the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Springboks</a> nine times. He made his debut for South Africa at the <a href="1999%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1999 Rugby World Cup</a>, in a match against <a href="Spain%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Spain</a>. His usual position is as a centre.
Julies played for the <a href="Bulls%20%28rugby%29">Bulls</a> in the 2007 <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super 14</a> season. Also in the Super 12/14, he has been with the <a href="Lions%20%28Super%20rugby%20franchise%29">Cats</a> and the <a href="Stormers">Stormers</a>. He was also part of South Africa's victorious <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> squad, having been called in as an injury replacement for <a href="Jean%20de%20Villiers">Jean de Villiers</a>, who tore a bicep during the pool stages. He moved to France in 2009 to play for <a href="Pays%20d%27Aix%20RC">Pays d'Aix RC</a>.
In the 2011 season Wayne Julies began to play for a Premier League B Rugby team from the Sir Lowries Pass area called Sir Lowrians where he played outside center. He also took on coaching duties for the club.
